title: Command Injection
description: The code constructs command strings using user input without proper validation or sanitization, which can lead to command injection vulnerabilities.
fix: Validate and sanitize all user inputs before constructing command strings. Use parameterized commands or APIs that prevent command execution through string manipulation.

reasoning.pattern: The code uses `_tcscpy_s` to copy user input into a buffer without validation, which can lead to command injection if the input contains malicious characters.
reasoning.exploit_example: An attacker could provide a specially crafted input that includes shell metacharacters (e.g., `; rm -rf /`) to execute arbitrary commands on the system.
